info.name: Corticobulbar tract
info.description: The corticobulbar tract is a descending pathway (of Upper Motor Neurons) that originates in the cerebral cortex, travels through the posterior limb of the internal capsule, basis pedunculi of the midbrain, basilar pons and the pyramid of the medulla. Along its path through the brain stem it terminates or synapes (bilaterally in most, but not all, cases) on both motor and sensory nuclei. Since clinically it generally refers to only those fibers ending on motor nuclei (Lower Motor Neurons), it is considered the brainstem counterpart of the Corticospinal tract which follows the same course but terminates in the spinal cord.
